Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder and neck section of a red-brown pottery vessel, the base of one handle survives, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is thickly-caked with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and the smudged remains of a few words of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393426) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393426)
